channel.name: Does anyone have an example of sending a transaction JSON to auro wallet to sign?

messages.content:
I am experimenting with generating a transaction on a server and sending a transaction JSON to the frontend to sign and send.  In auro wallet I get the error `Error: TypeError: n is undefined` before I try to "send" my TX.  Then when I try to send it, I get `e is undefined`.

I'm sourcing the json from my server doing the normal `Mina.transaction(...) ... .toJSON()`
Can you send me the generated json ? Shall I give it a try?

embeds.title: test-zkapp/ui/src/components/HomeComponents/SignTransactionBox.tsx ...
embeds.description: AURO E2E Test zkApp. Contribute to aurowallet/test-zkapp development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: This is what's in my "data" tab in auro, do you see anything fishy?

What is your Auro Wallet version? I just tested the latest version `2.2.13` of Auro Wallet in the google extension store, . It can be send normally.
This is the broadcast result
https://minascan.io/berkeley/tx/5JuNiq8dMvk2H6XGsbZEWeEpK8Qk3v1EmjtgWCbJCxUSA49grnqU?type=zk-tx

embeds.title: Minascan Block Explorer
embeds.description: Minascan is a Block Explorer and Analytics Platform for Mina, a lightweight succinct blockchain that uses ZK-proofs.

messages.content: Ah I haven’t updated in a while!  Ill try that!
Dont know it it has been fixed, but @DFST reported it: "It is a known bug in o1js: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1221in

messages.content: Btw, we plan to find if it can be fixed fix for the zkCloudWorker project.

embeds.title: transaction.sign produces an invalid signature after import from JS...
embeds.description: In case the transaction is exported to JSON, then imported from JSON, signed after import, and sent, the “Check signature: Invalid signature” error is thrown, and the authorization field of the tra...

messages.content: And this is what I tried and failed https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1193298287567048818/1193298287567048818
I don't think this is the issue here!

Sorry if it is not , but it seemed just like what I have tried before:
```
I am experimenting with generating a transaction on a server and sending a transaction JSON to the frontend to sign and send.  In auro wallet I get the error `Error: TypeError: n is undefined` before I try to "send" my TX.  Then when I try to send it, I get `e is undefined`.

I'm sourcing the json from my server doing the normal `Mina.transaction(...) ... .toJSON()```
Yes, you are right, sorry for the confusion 🙏🏻

This error is generally caused by a mismatch between the signature version and the node's verification signature. Generally, you can check the o1js version and the Auro Wallet version. Try to keep the latest versions of these two

Yes, I know that. That is exactly what worries me 😦 In the zkCloudWorker we poposed just this. See this diagram from the propsal https://zkignite.minaprotocol.com/zkignite/dev-tooling-infra-cohort-3_104/funding/suggestion/689

embeds.title: zkCloudWorker: a fast cloud proving service for zkApps
embeds.description: In the fast-paced realm of ZK proving, zkCloudWorker stands out as a potential game-changer for both zkApp developers and users. By delivering ultra-fast proving in the cloud, along with robust isolation, composability, and an excellent user experience (UX), zkCloudWorker has the potential to significantly streamline and expedite the development...

messages.content: And the point that we can have mismatch between different cloud workers using different  o1js versions is exactly what worries me.  And may be a **huge pain point for users** and developers. Imagine some cloud worker using o1js 0.16.0. Different users may have different wallet versions installed so, in some cases signing the "serialized" transaction coming from the same worker will pass and in some other cases will fail. This is much worse when going into mainnet, when the app production releases can not/wiil not change at the same pace as o1js versions.

There is a new feature in Mina protocol and o1js 0.16.0 that helps with it: 

Protocol change that adds a "transaction version" to the permission to set verification keys https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/pull/14407
